subhead: Did the terrorist organization target France on November 13, 2015 because of its military operations or the values it represents? The timeline of events and accounts from jihadists reveal a tangle of complex causes.

Record-breaking US shutdown ends after House vote
subhead: On Wednesday, President Trump signed a bill to end the 43-day government shutdown – the longest in US history. The full financial toll of the shutdown has yet to be determined, although estimates show $14 billion in lost growth. Meanwhile, many Democrats are fuming over what they consider capitulation by their party's leaders.

title: Boualem Sansal's release: How discreet diplomacy triumphed over 'a show of strength'
subhead: Unlike his predecessor, French Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez has advocated for 'calm but uncompromising cooperation' with Algiers.

title: Mimmo the dolphin, Venice's latest attraction
subhead: Since the start of summer, the dolphin has delighted tourists but raised concerns among Venetians. Experts have mobilized to move him away in order to prevent injuries.

subhead: In a joint interview, Denis Peschanski and Francis Eustache discuss the November 13 Program, launched in early 2016. This unique multidisciplinary project combines research in the humanities, social sciences and neuroscience.

title: In the year leading up to November 13 Paris attacks, a series of missed opportunities
subhead: A year passed between the Islamic State's decision to carry out a mass killing in France and the attacks of November 13, 2015. Twelve months during which intelligence services missed many opportunities to put a stop to this terrorist cell.

title: Rosalía returns with mystical album: 'God has given me so much, the least I could do is make an album for him'
subhead: Three albums and a string of hit singles have propelled her to the ranks of global pop divas. After a three-year hiatus, the 33-year-old Catalan artist returns with 'Lux,' a musical fresco in praise of the divine and major female saints.
